page.title: 05CROUGHLY
page.content: Croughly House was built in 1812 and as it is a listed building it must be maintained in good condition with no alteration or additions.There is a forestry plantation around the buildings.The occupiers Mr and Mrs Lindsay run a farm at Croughly.The crops grown are turnips,swedes,barley, potatoes and rape. Much of the land is arable but there is also quite a lot of rough grazing ground.Hill sheep and beef cattle are bred.They have one Charolais bull and forty beef cows.A contractor cuts silage and hay in the summer.In the winter the beasts are fed on silage and hay and the sheep on sheep nuts, barley and hay.The main breed of sheep is Leicester.During August and November there is a mart in Tomintoul which is two miles from Croughly. Cattle and sheep are sold there then.{
